description:
Open tourist camp-sites

Explanatory notes for the following statistics:
45412 Monthly tourism survey

Definition:
Tourist camp-sites are enclosed areas that can be generally
accessed for a temporary accommodation of caravans, mobile
homes or tents. The monthly tourism survey covers only
tourist camp-sites which offer touring pitches, while camp-
sites with fixed pitches are not included. The difference
between touring and fixed pitches depends on the contracted
duration of stay at the tourist camp-site. Touring pitches
are usually hired for a period of a few days or weeks, while
fixed pitches are typically hired for several months or a
year.
